{"step_by_step_thinking": "The auriculotemporal nerve is a branch of the mandibular division of the trigeminal nerve (V3). It provides sensory innervation to the skin of the temple, external ear, and part of the scalp. The two roots of the auriculotemporal nerve encircle the middle meningeal artery, which is a branch of the maxillary artery. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Middle meningeal artery.", "answer_choice": "D"}
